results.title: Structure of the atom
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: physics”.
These programs explore the history and development of the model of the atom, from the hypothesis of early Greek philosophers to the wave-mechanical model of modern atomic physicists. Experiments by pioneer atomic scientists such as Bohr, Faraday, de Broglie and Rutherford are recreated through animation and their implications are discussed. The six 10 minute episodes are: 1. “The Earliest models” 2. “Smaller than smallest” 3. “The Rutherford Model” 4. “The Bohr Model” 5. “Spectra” 6.”The Wave-mechanic Model.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario

results.title: The Nature of colour: parts 1 and 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: physics”.
Shows the nature of white light by experiments involving the dispersion and re-combination of colours of the spectrum. Illustrates the nature of colour by demonstrations showing the reflection, transmission and absorption of colour.

results.title: Electricity
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: physics”.
Addresses the fundamentals of electrostatics and current electricity, helping students to form images of abstract concepts. The first three programs on electrostatics explains the charging of objects by contact and induction. The last three episodes on current electricity looks at electrical charge, current flow, potentail difference and resistance.

results.title: Buying for long-term use
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and Spectrum Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
Shows a panel of consumers turning back the clock a year and telling how accurate their predictions have been for major purchases made a year ago. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Kinetic theory of matter. Parts 1-4
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: physics”.
Presents episodes 1-4 - Diffusion, Expansion, Pressure and Compressibility. Relates properties of solids, liquids and gases - such as diffusion, expansion, pressure and compressibility - to the kinetic theory of matter. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Budgeting your money
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
This film shows four young people in different financial situations discussing their budgeting problems in conversations which lead to information on how budgets are made and carried out. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Wave-partical duality
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: physics”.
Traces the development of the various theories advanced to explain the behaviour of light, from the concepts of the ancient Greeks to current proven models. The contributions of Isaac Newtown, Christian Huygens, Thomas Young, Jean Foucault, Albert Einstein and others are outlined as are the reasons for the gradual acceptance of both particle and wave models and their eventual combination. The six 10 minute episodes are: 1. “The Particle model” 2. “The Wave model” 3. “The Electromagnetic model” 4. “The Quantum idea” 5. “Photons” 6. “Matter waves.”

The six 10 minute episodes are: 1. “The Particle model” 2. “The Wave model” 3. “The Electromagnetic model” 4. “The Quantum idea” 5. “Photons” 6. “Matter waves.”

results.title: Buying on credit
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and Creative Establishment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
Shows what credit is, how it works and some of the dangers involved in using credit. Uses a conversation between three young men to introduce finance charges, bank loans, downpayment, interest and instalment payments. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Buying services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
Shows the need for savings and the importance of investing wisely. Uses the experiences of a young man involved in an automobile accident to illustrate the importance of being financially prepared through having shopped around for the best insurance cover. Suitable for upper secondary level.
